snippet: The attack on a Swedish reporter was the first time in years that a foreigner appeared to have been specifically targeted and killed in Kabul.
abstract: Two men shoot and kill Swedish reporter Nils Horner on street in Kabul, Afghanistan; daylight attack is first time in years that a Westerner appears to have been specifically targeted and killed in Kabul; raises questions about safety of large international presence expected to remain after American-led combat forces depart in 2014; killing comes as tens of thousands gather for funeral of Vice Pres Muhammad Qasim Fahim.

byline.contributor: Haris Kakar and Habib Zahori contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The attack on a Swedish reporter was the first time in years that a foreigner appeared to have been specifically targeted and killed in Kabul.

headline.main: Western Journalist Is Shot and Killed as Kabul Mourns Official’s Death
headline.print_headline: Western Journalist Is Shot and Killed as Kabul Mourns Official’s Death
